name: Fighter Command Overclock
tags: special, Fighters, offensive, merc, no_build_in, non_phase, req_military, vEx_safetyoverrides, fighter_fast_launch
desc:
Overclocking the fighter command unit, replacement rate no longer decreases due to fighter loss.
Convert replacement rates into reserve deployments, and allows the zero-flux engine boost to take effect regardless of flux level.

Reduces the peak performance time by a factor of %s and drastically reduces fighter operating range by %s.
short: Drastic improvement in performance, much lower peak time.

name: Advanced Carrier
desc:
Fighter wing receive %s time dilation and increased operating range
Fighter EMP damage taken reduced by %s
Carrier in-combat sight range increased by %s
short: Greatly improved fighters.

name: Swarm Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Increases the available hanger by %s/%s for cruisers/capital ships.

Due to extra stress on ship logistics, fighter manufactory suffers degraded performance. The fewer decks a ship orignially has, the higher the penalty.
Increase monthly maintenance cost by %s per added flight deck.
For non-automated ship, increase required crew by %s per added flight deck.

Can not be installed on a frigate or a destroyer, and can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: More fighter decks, reduced fighter replacement speed

name: Ace Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Deploy one single wing with significantly enhanced status but costs additional %s ordnance points.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: Exchange deck count for one enhanced wing

name: Skirmish Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Increases fighter top speed and acceleration by %s and allows zero-flux bonus to take effect at %s flux.

Reduces all fighter weapon range by %s.
Reduces fighter missile tracking by %s.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: Faster fighter but worse weapons

name: Command Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Increases fighter operation range by %s.
Carrier in-combat sight range increased by %s.
Increases the command point recovery rate by %s when installed on the flagship.

Reduces carrier max speed by %s.
Increases carrier zero-flux speed bonus by the lost max speed.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: Long range carrier but low mobility when engage

name: Support Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Each surviving fighter gives various bonuses

Each interceptor gives %s ECM rating
Each bomber or assault fighter gives %s coordinated maneuver
Each general fighter or support fighter reduces %s fleet-wide range reduction penalty casued by ECM disadvantage

Fighters receive remote armor and hull repair near it's mothership. The repair rate is %s within %s range, and linearly reduces the heal rate to 0 until %s range from the mothership.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: Apply various fleet-wide bonus

name: Avatar Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, Fighters, special, non_phase, merc, carrier_core
desc:
Captain is the embodiment of a ship, and so should it be the embodiment of fighters.
Create clone of the ship captain as fighter pilots.

Effects that are applied prior to entering battle will not apply, for instance, maximum missile from missile spec and combat readiness from combat endurance.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: REEEEEEE

name: Manufactory Load Balance
desc:
Redistributes manufactory production power, an idle manufactory transfers its replacement rate to a bay replacing lost fighters.

Also provides a combat UI to inform current replacement rate of each fighter bay.

If you have empty fighter bay(s), each empty bay will be transformed into %s replacement rate reserve that can be supplied to fighter bays that has suffered replacement rate loss
short: More effective fighter replacement at times.

name: Gunship Heavy Ordnance
desc:
Load fighter with heavy ordnance in exchange of agility.

Fighter rate of fire increased by %s.
Fighter flux dissipation increased by %s.
Fighter max speed and maneuverability reduced by %s.

The effect does not apply to bombers
short: Fighter project more firepower but much slower speed

name: Bomber External Hardpoint
desc:
Mount additional ammunitions on bomber's external hardpoints

Bomber ammo increased by %s

When a bomber is carrying over maximum capacity ammunition, the following penalties apply:
Damage reduced by %s
Max speed and maneuverability reduced by %s

A bombing run will last no less than %s seconds.
short: Double ammo for bomber but extremely slow before emptying ammo

name: Advanced Fighter Command
desc:
When a wing suffers fighter loss, increase replacement speed according to wing loss severity, up to %s when wing is fully destroyed.

When launching fighter with the system, it will cost additional replacement rate. The cost is proportional to fighter replacement time and the replacement speed bonus. If such cost would drop replacement rate below minimum allowed replacement rate, safety protocol will terminate the launch and resume to default replacement algorithm.
short: Force launch fighter at cost of replacement rate when wing eliminated

name: Fighter Armor Removal
desc:
Removes all fighter armor for better agility and flux status.

For every %s base armor:
Increase max speed by %s.
Increase maneuverability by %s.
Increase %s flux capacity
Increase %s flux disippation
short: Remove fighter armor for better agility and flux status.

name: Steady Bombing Protocol
desc: Bombers slow down to deplete the bomb bay before reaching target.
short: Bomber slows down

name: Autopilot Interface
desc: An interface for AI core to control manned fighters.
short: Allows regular fighters to be used by automated carriers

name: Disposable Fighter Shield Emitter
desc:
When a fighter is overloaded, the fighter ditches the shield to prevent overloading and removes %s flux in the process.

If a fighter does not have a shield, install a %s degree %s shield at %s shield efficiency
short: Fighter ditch shield when overload

name: Bastion Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, special, Fighters, merc, non_phase, carrier_core, req_military
desc:
Reduce fighter operating range to %s.

Fighter damage taken reduced by %s. 
Fighter non-missile weapon range increased by %s. 
Fighter missile max speed increased by %s.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: Fighter bounded to carrier with greatly enhanced performance

name: Electronic Superiority
desc:
Each active fighter or interceptor grants %s ECM rating.

The effect does not apply to bombers
short: Fighter has ECM

name: Targeting Data Link
desc: Establish data link between carrier and its fighters, apply targeting unit bonus to fighters
short: Fighter benefits from carrier targeting unit

name: Flux Quantum Entanglement
desc:
Fighter transfers all flux to carrier. 
Applies additional hard flux at %s of transferred flux.

Important note:
Extremely high burst damage may overload a fighter before it can channel flux to carrier.

Does not transfer flux when either fighter or carrier is overloaded or venting.
short: Fighter transfers flux to carrier

name: Burnout Reactor
desc:
Fighters no longer overload.

Any flux above %s is transformed into hull damage.
short: Fighter never overload but burns

name: Alpha Carrier Core
tags: req_spaceport, Fighters, special, non_phase, merc, carrier_core
desc:
AI can assist fighter controls and greatly imrpove fighter performance.

Can not work in conjunction with another Carrier Core.
short: REEEEEEE
